result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jade M. Perrin

defendant.name: Perrin, Jade M.
defendant.address: Regency Inn 1828 S Hastings Way #121, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Cases called at 1:27 PM: 21CF383, 21CF1069, 21CF1312, 22CF295, 22CF298. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Jade M. Perrin appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah Correctional.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Jade M. Perrin.  District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives her right to personal appearance.  22CF295 and 22CF298: Defendant is advised of charges, waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Attorney Thorson requests an adjournment to review the offer with the Defendant. Court grants 30 days to file motions.
1:32 PM: Off record for Attorney Thorson to speak with the Defendant in a break-out room. 
Case recalled at 1:36 PM.
STC: 12/22/22 at 2:00 PM.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cases called at 2:14 PM: 21CF383, 21CF1069, 21CF1312, 22CF295, 22CF298.
Defendant Jade M. Perrin appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah Correctional.   Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jade M. Perrin.  District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives her right to personal appearance.
21CF295: State calls Investigator Lance Maske of the ECCSO. He is sworn and testifies.
Court takes judicial notice of the signed bonds in Eau Claire County Cases 21CF1312, 21CF1069, 21CF383 and Chippewa County Case 21CF175. Witness identifies the Defendant via video.
Cross examination by Defense. Witness excused. Defense argues probable cause. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Judge Barna Judicial Assistant to schedule further proceedings.
21CF298: State calls Officer Wayne Bjorkman of the ECPD. He is sworn and testifies.
Court takes judicial notice of the signed bonds in Eau Claire County Cases 21CF1312, 21CF1069, 21CF383 and Chippewa County Case 21CF175. Witness identifies the Defendant via video.
Cross examination by Defense. Witness excused. Defense argues probable cause. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Judge Barna Judicial Assistant to schedule further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Cases 21CF383, 21CF1069, 21CF1312, 22CF295, 22CF298 are called at 2:56 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Jade M. Perrin appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah Correctional.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jade M. Perrin.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates the Defendant would like a preliminary hearing in 22CF295, 22CF298, but would request to appear by Zoom. 
Preliminary Hearings in 22CF295, 22CF298: 08/09/2022 at 2:00 PM (Zoom approved for Defendant). 21CF383, 21CF1069, 21CF1312 ride along for scheduling.
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum for a hearing on 07/25/2022 at 3:00 p.m.

(2:54 PM cases 21CF383, 21CF1069, 21CF1312, 22CF295, 22CF298 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jade M. Perrin appeared by video, in custody in Taycheedah Correctional Institution. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jade M. Perrin. 
Attorney Thorson advises has an offer from the State and needs to discuss further with the defendant.
Attorney Thorson advises will address the preliminary hearing in cases 22CF295 and 22CF298 at the next hearing.
Hearing in cases 22CF295, 22CF298 and Status Conference in cases 21CF383, 21CF1069, 21CF1312 scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 3 PM (1/2 hour) in person.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:11 AM cases 22CF295 and 22CF298 called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jade M. Perrin appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Sonia Anderson. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint. State requests $10,000 cash bond with argument. Defense requests a signature bond. 
Court orders $5,000 cash bond. Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3/28/22 at 2:15 PM.
Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
